title: Chesco twins get up to 23 months in jail for bombings
title_page: Chesco twins get up to 23 months in jail for bombings
maintext:
By Colt Shaw, Staff Writer
Twin brothers, who pleaded guilty to setting off bombs in Chester and Lancaster Counties while on Christmas break from colleges last year, have been sentenced to six to 23 months in prison, given three yearsâ€™ probation, and ordered not to have contact with each other for five years.
Daniel and Caleb Tate, 23, of Cochranville, were charged in connection with six incidents in December 2015 in which they detonated makeshift pipe bombs, five of which caused property damage. None caused injuries.
Continue reading on Philly.com
